before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"58j9f","text":"Please review the preparation materials in each section before starting.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"dqff4","text":"Multiomic technologies are increasingly being used on human samples and generating multidimensional data. Preanalytical and tissue procurement factors can have a lasting and negative effect on omic results.  For these data to be biologically and clinically useful, it is essential that high quality samples are obtained with rigor and reproducibility.   By using kidney tissue procurement as an example, we present an end-to-end detailed pipeline from living donor patient consent to tissue procurement and processing that has been extensively tested on various atlasing projects and multiple tissue types including the Human Biomolecular Atlas Program (HuBMAP) and the Kidney Precision Medicine Project (KPMP).   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Preparation: Obtaining Consent and Preparing to Collect the Kidney
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cstbq","text":"Identify the potential nephrectomy case.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Preparation: Obtaining Consent and Preparing to Collect the Kidney
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"de10d","text":"Request permission from the urologist to speak with the patient about possible consent.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Preparation: Obtaining Consent and Preparing to Collect the Kidney
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bl3ug","text":"Identify an opportunity to make initial contact with the patient, whether it be over the phone, at a preop appointment, or the day of the surgery.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Preparation: Obtaining Consent and Preparing to Collect the Kidney
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"d0j8l","text":"Obtain consent from the patient.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Preparation: Obtaining Consent and Preparing to Collect the Kidney
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3an96","text":"Notify the urologist of the patient’s consent so they will be aware that you will be retrieving and transporting the kidney to the gross room once it is removed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Preparation: Obtaining Consent and Preparing to Collect the Kidney
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9frj8","text":"Notify pathology/gross room of the scheduled date/time of the nephrectomy.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Preparation: Obtaining Consent and Preparing to Collect the Kidney
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"760uk","text":"Determine what additional information or items the gross room will need to accompany the kidney, such as:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"585qt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"brsus","text":"Requisition for the pathology assessment","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bfj1t","text":"Patient Labels","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4dsr8","text":"Documentation confirming that research consent has been obtained","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6qf61","text":"Etc.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"frgne","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"76gsg","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bu8qp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"be7uj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":121,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"71rgj","text":"Tip: Hospital issued scrubs will be needed to enter the operating room, so make arrangements to have those ahead of time.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"25urb","text":"Prepare supplies (see next section Preparation: Before Kidney Arrival).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"mkog","text":"Once the surgery begins, make contact with the circulating nurse in the assigned operating room (via phone or in person):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a6dof","text":"Let him/her know that you will be transporting the kidney to pathology/gross room immediately upon removal.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5egpj","text":"Provide a list of the items you will need from the operating room to accompany the kidney to the gross room (i.e., requisition, patient labels, etc.).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6jt03","text":"If possible, ask the nurse to document the Clamp Time/Last Staple Time (you will need this later to calculate the warm ischemic time).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":43,"length":27}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3p5c4","text":"Make certain the nurse knows that you will be taking the kidney fresh and   (No formalin).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":74,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"99vve","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2l7q7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":165}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":110}],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":230,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"f3agh","text":"Tip: If possible, leave a cooler with ice in the operating room so the kidney can still immediately be placed   in the event that you are unable to be there at the time of kidney removal. This will help ensure tissue preservation.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"er1bu","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":165},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"temperature"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"20h46","text":"Make certain the nurse has a good contact phone number for you and request a phone call when the kidney is getting ready to be removed from the body.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"npvp","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4sevd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":87,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"7ujg8","text":"Tip: Have your name and contact number easily legible on the cooler for easy reference.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9rbmh","text":"Gently remove each piece of tissue using forceps and rinse thoroughly in a small dish of PBS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8potf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6298v","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"20fhp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":93,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"5qfqd","text":"Alternative Rinsing Technique: Pour contents of 4% PFA tube into a small dish with a strainer","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":69,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"3t18k","text":"(possibly an empty FFPE cassette) and rinse with PBS using a pipette.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: 4% PFA Samples (make fresh or use within 4 days, keep cold):
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"881dl","text":"Gently place rinsed tissue back in tube prefilled with PBS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8d01q","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3q70u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":92,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"18p4m","text":"Tip: Same tube in which tissue was fixed can be re-used, however, make sure to indicate this","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":74,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"dph0e","text":"change of solution on the tube by crossing out “4% PFA” and writing “PBS.”","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

Solution can be changed a few times to ensure residual PFA is washed out.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":56,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":85,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fdrh8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":86400,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

steps.section: 4% PFA Samples (make fresh or use within 4 days, keep cold):
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1g95n","text":"DAY 3: After specimens have rinsed in PBS they can be processed for either cryopreservation using sucrose to make a fixed frozen block (FFB) or prepared for paraffin embedding to make a paraffin block (PB).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ebc6c","text":"Assign unique Specimen Label (derivative of parent label) for each FFB – using our nomenclature, on the Worksheet, put a square around the next consecutive number after the O.C.T. blocks to indicate “Fixed Frozen Block” (i.e., K2300003_4FFB - This is your first piece of fixed frozen tissue. Your second piece of fixed frozen tissue under this parent number would be K2300003_5FFB and so on); see example Worksheet at the beginning of this section.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":30,"length":26},{"style":"italic","offset":73,"length":375}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"b9qec","text":"Label new 2mL tube with Specimen Label and “sucrose”.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d58nl","text":"Fill tubes with prepared sucrose (reference Supply List – Section (D) Processing Liquids).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":44,"length":44}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7h7aj","text":"Place assigned tissue in “sucrose” tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f6jub","text":"Document sample type on Worksheet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":24,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7nspi","text":"Place new sucrose tubes on a rocker within cold room ( ) and let rock for around 1-  until specimen sinks to bottom of tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":54,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":83,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a3pi5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":345600,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9bdff","text":"Once specimen sinks, freeze in O.C.T. using instructions for processing (refer section \"Fresh Frozen Tissue (FB)\" above).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":88,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7u0s3","text":"Assign unique Specimen Label (derivative of parent label) for each PB – using our nomenclature, on the Worksheet, put a triangle around the next consecutive number after the FFB blocks to indicate “Paraffin Block” (i.e., K2300003_6PB - This is your first piece of fixed paraffin tissue. Your second piece of fixed paraffin tissue under this parent number would be K2300003_7PB and so on.); see example Worksheet at the beginning of this section (_7PB not shown).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":30,"length":26},{"style":"italic","offset":72,"length":390}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"35k3f","text":"Label new 2mL tube with Specimen Label and “30% EtOH”.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c3fm6","text":"Fill tubes with prepared 30% EtOH (reference Supply List – Section (D) Processing Liquids).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":45,"length":44}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"cr1l2","text":"Place assigned tissue in “30% EtOH” tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5v51o","text":"Place new 30% EtOH tubes on a rocker within cold room ( ) and let rock for several hours to  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":55,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":92,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8euvm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":86400,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":["overnight"],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bfsit","text":"After several hours to overnight remove 30% EtOH from tube using small pipette (leaving tissue in place).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5sa21","text":"Replace 30% EtOH with 70% EtOH (reference Supply List – Section (D) Processing Liquids for 70% EtOH recipe).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":42,"length":44}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"eft6h","text":"Cross out 30% EtOH and write 70% EtOH on tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"24shl","text":"Place new 70% EtOH tubes on a rocker within cold room ( ) until ready to make paraffin blocks.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":55,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2h2gu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}
